channel.title: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT
channel.description:
Question:
I join my server by logging in with: Server IP: 0.0.0.0 Port: 43594
Others try to join my server with: Server IP: name_of_server.no-ip.info Port: 43594
I can logon but noone else can. I have read the probably about every guide on here. I think have forwarded ALL my ports correctly. Disabled Firewalls. Disabled Anti-virus.
What could mainly be the problem is my router and mode. I have a seperate router and a seperate modem:
DSL --> modem --> router --> Wireless
Thats my setup ^
My router ip is 192.168.128.1 and my modem ip is 192.168.1.1 Both of those can not be the same or my internet won't work.
Under my modem, here is some information:
LAN - Setup DHCP DHCP Server Client IP Pool Starting Address 192.168.1.2 Size of Client IP Pool 1 Primary DNS Server 0.0.0.0 Secondary DNS Server 0.0.0.0 Remote DHCP Server N/A
TCP/IP IP Address 192.168.1.1 IP Subnet Mask 255.255.255.252 RIP Direction Both RIP Version RIP-2B Multicast IGMP-v2
This is under Site Map on my Modem:
Site Map
Wizard Setup Advanced Setup Maintenance Wizard Setup Password System Status LAN DHCP Table NAT Diagnostic Security Firmware Dynamic DNS Remote Management
My modem is from Zyxel
My router (WRT54GS) 's:
local Ip address: 192.168.128.1 Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0 Starting Ip address: 192.168.128.100 Static DNS 1 (2 and 3 as well) is currently 0.0.0.0 ( I can change these)
Port Forward
43594 to 43594 TCP/UDP 192.168.128.100 Enabled
DMZ Host IP Address: 192.168.128.2
I DONT Have anything set under port triggering. I have a tab called QoS that looks kind of like port forwarding if I enable it.
1. I run No-Ip 2. I run the compiler.bat 3. I run runserver.bat 4. I login on my server 5. Noone else can log on
I have a video of my problem, download my video from:
http://rapidshare.com/files/76860847/clip0002.avi
Watch it on full screen so none of the text displays weird.
Then post what my problem could be.
Thanks....
NOTE: You can also watch it on youtube at:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nDTMP-ZeHzM
__________________
I think my problem is with my router and modem because I have followed on tutorials on creating a server. Please help.

item.title: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT
item.dc:creator: @vthokie4me vthokie4me
item.description:
@vthokie4me wrote:

The 2 ips are the same.

Read full topic
item.source: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT

item.title: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT
item.dc:creator: @ass_woop ass woop
item.description:
@ass_woop wrote:

I have a linksys router and i have a server without hamachi but i also use a modem so… you might have some other problems ill read the entire thing and see if i find anything. OH, i see the problem, you might need to go to no-ip.com and change the ip under the e-mail you logged in on under that on the top left, then modify the one you registered your host name as, if you dont need to change the ip try to run the no-ip and keep it on while you have the server up

~ass woop

Read full topic
item.source: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT

item.title: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT
item.dc:creator: @Goddess Goddess
item.description:
@Goddess wrote:

lol…i had this problem…some routers wont portforward right…if you are on your pc and not a laptop may i suggest just disconnecting the router?

Read full topic

item.title: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT
item.dc:creator: @_J_O_H_N [-J O H N-]
item.description:
@_J_O_H_N wrote:

Hmm, I’v never seen a person with linksys host a server on anything but Hamachi, which i need to learn how to use because my routers screwed :s.

Read full topic
item.source: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT

item.title: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I’m afraid that by the looks of it you set everything up correctly.
Port-forwarded correct, Windows Firewall is off, it’s all right.
So there is only one last thing that could possibly be causing the problem:
Another firewall.
Check your entire computer for any signs of a firewall. This includes:
ZoneAlarm, Nortan, McAfee, etc.
I remember once before I had ZoneAlarm, and although I exited the program, the firewall process was still up and running.

Only thing I can think of, sorry.

Read full topic
item.source: Network help - Server help - I can log on but others CANT

Question:

I join my server by logging in with:
Server IP: 0.0.0.0
Port: 43594

Others try to join my server with:
Server IP: name_of_server.no-ip.info
Port: 43594

I can logon but noone else can. I have read the probably about every guide on here. I think have forwarded ALL my ports correctly. Disabled Firewalls. Disabled Anti-virus.

What could mainly be the problem is my router and mode. I have a seperate router and a seperate modem:

DSL --> modem --> router --> Wireless

Thats my setup ^

My router ip is 192.168.128.1 and my modem ip is 192.168.1.1
Both of those can not be the same or my internet won’t work.

Under my modem, here is some information:

LAN - Setup
DHCP
DHCP Server
Client IP Pool Starting Address 192.168.1.2
Size of Client IP Pool 1
Primary DNS Server 0.0.0.0
Secondary DNS Server 0.0.0.0

This is under Site Map on my Modem:

Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0
Starting Ip address: 192.168.128.100
Static DNS 1 (2 and 3 as well) is currently 0.0.0.0 ( I can change these)

43594 to 43594 TCP/UDP 192.168.128.100 Enabled

I have a tab called QoS that looks kind of like port forwarding if I enable it.
